com.pump.awt.text

Class BlockLetter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.awt.text.BlockLetter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockLetter.Gradient, BlockLetter.Simple

    public abstract class BlockLetter
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a basic 3D representation of a letter. It has a fixed depth, so the dimensions of this effect can be calculated as:
    double dx = getDepth()*Math.cos(angle);
    double dy = getDepth()*Math.sin(angle);

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BlockLetter.Gradient
      This BlockLetter supports two different types of gradients.
      static class  BlockLetter.Simple
      This BlockLetter has no gradients; the depth of the letter is one uniform (unnuanced) Paint:

    • Method Detail

      • getDepth

        public float getDepth()
        Return the total depth of this BlockLetter. This is the hypotenuse of displacement; to identify the x and y displacement use:
        double dx = getDepth()*Math.cos(angle);
        double dy = getDepth()*Math.sin(angle);

        If this is zero, then this BlockLetter should simply render as the original character glyph.

        Returns:
        the total depth of this BlockLetter.

      • getCharWidth

        public float getCharWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of this character.

      • paintDepth

        public abstract void paintDepth(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                float x,
                                float y)
        Paint the depth ("the 3D part") of this BlockLetter.
        Parameters:

      • paintForeground

        public void paintForeground(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                            float x,
                            float y)
        Paint the foreground of this BlockLetter.

        If the method paintDepth() isn't invoked, then this method will still present normal-looking (non-3D) text.

        Parameters:
        g - the graphics to draw to
        x - the x-coordinate indicating where to paint.
        y - the y-coordinate indicating where to paint.

      • prep

        protected java.awt.Graphics2D prep(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                   float x,
                                   float y)
        Prepares this Graphics2D to paint this BlockLetter at the given (x,y) coordinate.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graphics2D to paint to
        x - the x-coordinate to paint to
        y - the y-coordinate to paint to
        Returns:
        a cloned Graphics2D to paint to. When complete you should dispose this Graphics2D.
